org.GameLogic.Clock

Class Clock

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.GameLogic.Clock.Clock
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ClockInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GameClock

    public class Clock
extends java.lang.Object
implements ClockInterface
    Base clock class. This class can be implemented when cyclic counter is needed.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Clock(long cycle)
      Instantiates clock.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void destroy()
      Clock will stop and thread will be canceled.
      long getCycle()
      Return cycle time in milliseconds.
      ClockState getState()
      Returns actual clockstate.
      long getTime()
      Return delta time in milliseconds.
      long getTimeLeft()
      Returns time left until clock repeats at zero.
      long getTotalTime()
      Returns total time the clock ticked.
      boolean isPaused()
      Clock will be paused.
      boolean isStarted()
      Returns true if clock is state started, otherwise returns false.
      void pauseTicking()
      Pause ticking.
      void resumeTicking()
      Resume ticking.
      void startTicking()
      Ticking thread will be started and clock will tick.
      void ticking()
      Is called every given period of time.
      void timeElapsed()
      Have to be overwritten by inerhited classes.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • getTimeLeft

        public long getTimeLeft()
        Returns time left until clock repeats at zero. Time left is calculated by cycle-time.
        Returns:
        milliseconds

      • getTotalTime

        public long getTotalTime()
        Returns total time the clock ticked.
        Returns:

        public boolean isPaused()

        Resume ticking.

        public void startTicking()
        Ticking thread will be started and clock will tick.
